_header: The wise man his son forbade
_description: Advice to fathers regarding their sons’ career choice — one eight-line stanza (ababbcbc)

YaleBei163.First Lines:
The wyse man his sone for bedeMasons crafte and all
                    clymbynge…
YaleBei163.Last Lines:
…Better þu were to kys the yatisAnd euer be warre or
                    þu be woo
YaleBei163.Editions:
Lass,  Roger. 
             “Three Middle English Cautionary Lyrics from a Yale University
                Ms.” 
             Anglia
         83 (1965): 172-5: 172.
